Detailed Description

IO device for compressing/decompressing data as it is read or written.

DzGzIO provides a QIODevice that compresses or decompresses data as it is read or written from another device. This provides efficient compression/decompression for large data streams with the easy to use QIODevice interface. Random access is not practical for compressed data streams, so this class provides either ReadOnly or WriteOnly modes (not ReadWrite) for data access and no seek functionality.

int  compressionLevel = 6,
int  bufferSize = 65536

General Constructor. Creates a new GZip IO device.

Parameters:
device The underlying IO device that compressed data is read from or written to.
compressionLevel The compression level to use when compressing data.
bufferSize The size of the compression/decompression buffer.
DzGzIO::~DzGzIO (  ) 

Destructor. Closes the device if it is open.

Member Function Documentation

qint64 DzGzIO::bytesAvailable (  )  const [virtual]

Reimplemented from QIODevice. There is no way of knowing the final size of the uncompressed data, so this function returns the minimum amount of bytes available.

Returns:
The minimum number of remaining bytes.
void DzGzIO::close (  )  [virtual]

Reimplemented from QIODevice. Closes the device if it is currently open. If the underlying device was opened by this device, this function will also close the underlying device, otherwise, the underlying device remains open.

void DzGzIO::flush (  )  [virtual]

Reimplemented from QIODevice. Flushes the current compression buffer. Calling this function can reduce compression ratio.

bool DzGzIO::isSequential (  )  const [virtual]

Reimplemented from QIODevice. Compressed files must always be treated as sequential.

Returns:
true
bool DzGzIO::open ( OpenMode  mode  )  [virtual]

Reimplemented from QIODevice. Opens the device and initializes compression or decompression. If the underlying device is not open, it will be opened with the given mode. If the underlying device is already open, the mode it was opened with must be compatibile with the given mode.

Parameters:
mode Must be ReadOnly or WriteOnly - other modes will fail to open the file.
Returns:
true on success, false if an error occurred.
qint64 DzGzIO::readData ( char *  data,
qint64  maxSize 
) [protected, virtual]

Reimplemented from QIODevice. Reads data out of the decompression buffer, refilling the buffer with data from the underlying device and decompressing as it goes.

Parameters:
data The buffer that will receive the decompressed data.
maxSize The maximum number of bytes to copy into the buffer.
Returns:
The number of bytes actually copied into the buffer.
qint64 DzGzIO::writeData ( const char *  data,
qint64  maxSize 
) [protected, virtual]

Reimplemented from QIODevice. Writes data into the compression buffer, compressing the data and writing it to the underlying device when the buffer becomes full.

Parameters:
data The data to compress and write to the underlying device.
maxSize The number of bytes in the given data.
Returns:
The number of bytes from the given data that were actually compressed.
